content:
Wow, $1,300 is an incredible savings on a designer handbag! You must have been thrilled to score that deal. It's great that you've developed a system for finding and negotiating deals, and it's paid off for you over the years.

I completely understand the excitement of finding a great deal. It's like a rush, isn't it? The thrill of the hunt, the satisfaction of knowing you've scored an amazing bargain... it's a great feeling!

It's also smart of you to resell items that no longer fit or suit your style. It's a great way to declutter your closet and make some extra money, and it's also more sustainable than buying new. You're giving the items a second life, and that's something to be proud of.

Poshmark and eBay are both great platforms for reselling, and it's awesome that you've had success with them. Have you ever considered selling on other platforms, like Depop or Mercari? They're both popular options for reselling fashion items, and they might be worth exploring.

Also, I'm curious - what's your favorite thing about secondhand shopping? Is it the thrill of the hunt, the environmental benefits, or something else entirely?
